pageContext.claim: “As of yesterday, we’ve had 133 record days in the stock market now, and that’s in less than three years.”
pageContext.analysis: The stock market is doing well, but Trump’s scorekeeping is fishy. For example, on Oct. 10, he said “the stock market today just hit another all-time high,” but the Dow Jones industrial average was higher nine days earlier. According to the Balance, a personal finance website, the Dow Jones had broken 44 records from the time Trump took office through Jan. 9, 2020.
